> Currently the idea is to setup a bunch of rules, set the scenarios 
and
> starting conditions, and then having people play through them 
however they
> want.
> It's an honour based system, to help reduce cheating it was 
suggested that
> people submit their saved games every 5 levels and the details from 
them
> would be put up on a website - there people could challenge players 
if they
> thought they were cheating and some tournament admins would go 
through the
> scenarios themself and see if they came out with similar results or 
not.

That's the only potential rule out there right now.  The idea of 
submitting saved games after 5 scenarios or so and posting details 
from the saved games was my idea for the reasons stated above.  There 
are 2 polls out there right now dealing with the tournament: the 1st 
about which scenarios to use and the 2nd about how many scenarios in 
the tournament.

I would rather have the discuss about the rules in this area, but I am 
afraid of boring people who are not interested in a tournament.  
Besides rules for the tournament, there has to be discussion about 
what criteria to use for choosing scenarios for the tournament - I 
expect that discussion to be rather heated.
